Class Inventory

java.lang.Object
Inventory
public class Inventory extends Object
This class is the available inventory of Chip, this class will change its attributes upon collection of items, reset of level, and interacting with doors This class features the use of characters to identify which item will be acquired in the inventory

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Inventory()
    Constructor for the Inventory class that automatically sets the inventory to fire boots and flippers to false upon the start of the game

    • hasRedKey

      public boolean hasRedKey()
      Determines if chip has a single red key
      Returns:
      true - if red keys are currently 1 or more, false - if red keys are 0

    • hasBlueKey

      public boolean hasBlueKey()
      Determines if chip has a single blue key
      Returns:
      true - if blue keys are currently 1 or more, false - if blue keys are 0

    • hasFlippers

      public boolean hasFlippers()
      Determines if chip has a flipper
      Returns:
      true - if chip has a flipper object in the inventory, false - if not

    • hasFireBoots

      public boolean hasFireBoots()
      Determines if chip has a fire boots
      Returns:
      true - if chip has a fire boots object in the inventory, false - if not

    • getChips

      public int getChips()
      Determines how many chips the player has
      Returns:
      chips - the current number of chips inside player's inventory

    • useRedKey

      public void useRedKey()
      Removes red key in inventory upon use on red door

    • useBlueKey

      public void useBlueKey()
      Removes blue key in inventory upon use on blue door

    • getRedKeys

      public int getRedKeys()
      Determines how many red keys the player has
      Returns:
      redKeys - the current number of red keys inside player's inventory

    • getBlueKeys

      public int getBlueKeys()
      Determines how many blue keys the player has
      Returns:
      blueKeys - the current number of blue keys inside player's inventory

    • resetInventory

      public void resetInventory()
      When the game calls resetLevel() it resets all the count of the items and the game will restart and simulates game repeat
